name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A powerful tale of racial injustice in the American South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.
George Orwell's profound dystopia that explores surveillance and totalitarianism in a bleak future.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's classic romance that critically examines societal norms and the pursuit of suitable marriage.

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A story of impossible love, dreams, and tragedy set during the opulent Roaring Twenties.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's novel about teenage rebellion and alienation that has become a mid-20th-century classic.

name: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins' adventure to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon, a prelude to 'The Lord of the Rings'.

name: Moby Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby Dick.

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: Tolkien's masterpiece about the epic quest to destroy the One Ring, which chronicles the great War of the Ring.

name: Fahrenheit 451
description: Ray Bradbury's futuristic novel where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

name: Hamlet
description: Shakespeare's tragedy of the Prince of Denmark, who seeks revenge against his uncle, who has murdered Hamlet's father.
